definition: see 萬目睽睽|万目睽睽[wan4 mu4 kui2 kui2]
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: The senator's activity kept him in the public eye.
sentences.chinese: 参议员的活动使他常处于众目睽睽之下。

sentences.english: The thieving continued for several minutes in front of onlookers.
sentences.chinese: 盗窃行为在众目睽睽之下持续数分钟。

sentences.english: A cunning killer hides in plain sight.
sentences.chinese: 一个狡猾的凶手在众目睽睽下隐藏。

sentences.english: He committed hooliganism even under the watchful eyes of the people.
sentences.chinese: 他竟在众目睽睽之下犯下了流氓罪。

sentences.english: I feel sorry for famous people who live their lives in the glare of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我真可怜那些要在众目睽睽之下生活的名人。

sentences.english: "To fall flat on your face" is a metaphorical expression meaning to make a big mistake with everybody watching.
sentences.chinese: 是一个比喻的说法，含义是在众目睽睽之下犯大错。

definition: the full light of day (idiom)/fig. peace and prosperity/in broad daylight
in front of/in the presence of
to act as though there were nobody else present/unselfconscious/fig. without regard for others
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
in broad daylight/in the middle of the day/KMT emblem, a white sun on a blue background
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
